fields.headline: PDA's Newsbucket
fields.bodyText: • The writing is on the paywall >> Nicholas Carr • Remixable iPhone album points to future >> Wired • Google Chrome for Mac - first screenshots >> Mashable • Paid apps enter Google's Android market >> Mashable • How newspapers can make good use of Digg >> Econsultancy • Nokia opens new digital music stores in Europe >> mocoNews • Microsoft to move into retail with line of branded stores >> Guardian • YouTube allows users to download videos to computers and iPods >> Guardian • Twitter gets its big one: Raises $35m third round >> paidContent • London Twestival: Wigs, beer and hotpants at a very real world meet-up >> Guardian • Twestival a hit in Twitter's home town >> Guardian • Twitterers at the London Twestival tell Jemima Kiss why they love Twitter >> Guardian • Microsoft offers $250,000 bounty for capture of Conficker worm author >> Guardian • Peter Barron: Journalism 'underplayed tech revolution' >> Press Gazette • Google scraps broadcast radio ad business >> Independent • BBC iPlayer on Virgin: 100m views >> BBC Internet Blog • Google kills radio ad service, lays off 40 >> PC World • Google Japan apologises for awkward PR campaign >> TechCrunch • Twitter gets a style guide >> NYTimes • Apple says iPhone jailbreaking is illegal >> Electronic Frontier Foundation • Trends to watch for at Mobile World Congress >> GigaOM •Let's use our geekiness for good! >> GigaOM Via delicious
